notesStmt.note: Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Two uniform volumes containing detached portions of Maḥzor, provided with vowel-points and accents.

collation.p: Four quires of 8 leaves each. Marked with catchwords.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi square script, punctuated and accentuated, of 14th century. Shelomoh bar Yeḥiʾel, inscibed with his name on folio 32v, with a date of Nisan 5069 (1309).

binding.p: Post-1600, tooled brown leather with clasps. Spine: 'Job & Jeremiah. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 9406.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Adam Clarke (b. 1762, d. 1832), Wesleyan Methodist minister and scholar: his bookplate with Greek inscription: ho theos agape estin (inner upper cover). This manuscript formed part of the collection of ten Hebrew manuscripts, together with Add MS 9398-9407, once property of the Hagen family and then bought for Adam Clarke at Utrecht in 1823, acquired by the British Museum in 1834.
